cards.title: Alan Rusbridger / A life in the headlines

item.title: Alan Rusbridger: a life in the headlines
item.trailText: Alan Rusbridger reflects on the biggest stories that defined his 20 years as Guardian editor
item.standFirst: Alan Rusbridger stepped down last month as editor-in-chief of the Guardian and Observer. Here, as he approaches his final day in the role, he reflects on the biggest stories that defined his 20 years at the helm – including the Jonathan Aitken trial, WikiLeaks, phone-hacking, the showdown at the home affairs select committee and meeting Edward Snowden in Moscow

cards.title: World view / McAfee’s Knob, Virginia, US

item.title: World view: McAfee’s Knob, Virginia, US
item.trailText: Tosha Kowalski was working in IT in Wisconsin in 2014 when she saw a sticker saying: “Quit your job, see the world, fall in love, find yourself.” She hopped out of the rat race and spent 10 months backpacking and volunteering around Europe. Now she is walking the 3,500km Appalachian Trail from Georgia to Maine
item.standFirst:
Tosha Kowalski was working in IT in Wisconsin in 2014 when she saw a sticker on the ground saying: “Quit your job, see the world, fall in love, find yourself.” She hopped out of the rat race and spent 10 months backpacking and volunteering around Europe. Now she is walking the 3,500km Appalachian Trail from Georgia to Maine. After 50 days, she and her hiking partner, Emily, are 1,207km along. This shot was taken at McAfee’s Knob in Virginia. They are following the “leave no trace” policy: hiking until they find a beautiful spot to camp in or, if exhausted, the nearest flat spot.

  • Follow Tosha’s travels on her blog theotherforkintheroad.com and on Instagram

displayImages.altText: McAfee's Knob on Catawba Mountain in Virginia

headerImage.caption: McAfee’s Knob on Catawba Mountain in Virginia. Photograph by Tosha Kowalski
headerImage.altText: McAfee's Knob on Catawba Mountain in Virginia
headerImage.cleanCaption: McAfee’s Knob on Catawba Mountain in Virginia. Photograph by Tosha Kowalski

image.altText: McAfee's Knob on Catawba Mountain in Virginia

cards.title: Students and selfie sticks / Life in Sudan's capital

item.title: Students and selfie sticks: life in Sudan's capital
item.trailText: From politics to street parties and football rivalries, photographer Mohamed Nureldin Abdallah has documented youth culture in a city facing ongoing conflict and economic crisis
item.standFirst: From politics to street parties and football rivalries, photographer Mohamed Nureldin Abdallah has documented youth culture in a city facing ongoing conflict and economic crisis

displayImages.caption: Students share a joke outside their classroom at the Sudan university of science and technology in the capital, Khartoum In recent weeks the city’s students have made headlines as violent rhetoric against Darfuris has whipped up resentment and resulted in continuing clashes on campuses
displayImages.cleanCaption: Students share a joke outside their classroom at the Sudan university of science and technology in the capital, Khartoum In recent weeks the city’s students have made headlines as violent rhetoric against Darfuris has whipped up resentment and resulted in continuing clashes on campuses

displayImages.caption: Female students queue as they wait to buy breakfast at the university of science and technology In October the detention and arrest of female students prompted outcry from activists, who say there is systematic gender discrimination in the education system
displayImages.cleanCaption: Female students queue as they wait to buy breakfast at the university of science and technology In October the detention and arrest of female students prompted outcry from activists, who say there is systematic gender discrimination in the education system

displayImages.caption:
Young men reenact a scene from Titanic on a boat ride through the shallow waters of the Nile outside Khartoum
The capital has a strong youth culture, and in a one-party state governed by Omar al-Bashir, young people play a key role in opposition politics in parties such as Girifna, meaning ‘we are fed up’
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Young men reenact a scene from Titanic on a boat ride through the shallow waters of the Nile outside Khartoum
The capital has a strong youth culture, and in a one-party state governed by Omar al-Bashir, young people play a key role in opposition politics in parties such as Girifna, meaning ‘we are fed up’

displayImages.caption: A girl uses her mobile phone during the evening at the national park in the capital Facebook has become increasingly popular among Sudan’s young people as a way to chat online, but the government heavily monitors internet activity. Many younger users have taken to using proxy servers to avoid being tracked. The security forces have also reportedly deployed a “cyber jihad” unit to follow online activities and hack into activists’ social media accounts
displayImages.cleanCaption: A girl uses her mobile phone during the evening at the national park in the capital Facebook has become increasingly popular among Sudan’s young people as a way to chat online, but the government heavily monitors internet activity. Many younger users have taken to using proxy servers to avoid being tracked. The security forces have also reportedly deployed a “cyber jihad” unit to follow online activities and hack into activists’ social media accounts

displayImages.caption: Young men play dominoes at their local club in Omdurman Inflation and high unemployment rates makes life challenging for the youth population, many of whom struggle to find work
displayImages.cleanCaption: Young men play dominoes at their local club in Omdurman Inflation and high unemployment rates makes life challenging for the youth population, many of whom struggle to find work

displayImages.caption:
Ahmed, 23
Ahmed looks at his phone as a barber grooms his hair and beard for $3
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Ahmed, 23
Ahmed looks at his phone as a barber grooms his hair and beard for $3

displayImages.caption:
Monika, 24
Monika takes part in a boxing training session at a youth club in Khartoum
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Monika, 24
Monika takes part in a boxing training session at a youth club in Khartoum

displayImages.caption:
Young footballers in Omdurman
Sudan has a long footballing history. The home ground is the Al Merreikh Stadium in Omdurman, the rivalry between the main teams Al Hilal and Al Merrikh is amongst the fiercest in the continent
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Young footballers in Omdurman
Sudan has a long footballing history. The home ground is the Al Merreikh Stadium in Omdurman, the rivalry between the main teams Al Hilal and Al Merrikh is amongst the fiercest in the continent

displayImages.caption:
A wedding celebration in Khartoum
In December a professor caused outrage after he said on TV that the level of beauty in Sudan had ‘gone down’, adding: ‘most of them [women] are ugly’. Sara Elhassan, whose video criticising the comment went viral says that beauty is a big issue for Sudanese women: ‘We are consumed by appearance, the reigning look is light skinned women with long (straight) hair. In fact, you could argue that the professor raised some valid, if unfortunately phrased points when talking about the use of [skin lightening] creams’
displayImages.cleanCaption:
A wedding celebration in Khartoum
In December a professor caused outrage after he said on TV that the level of beauty in Sudan had ‘gone down’, adding: ‘most of them [women] are ugly’. Sara Elhassan, whose video criticising the comment went viral says that beauty is a big issue for Sudanese women: ‘We are consumed by appearance, the reigning look is light skinned women with long (straight) hair. In fact, you could argue that the professor raised some valid, if unfortunately phrased points when talking about the use of [skin lightening] creams’

displayImages.caption:
A selfie stick in the Nile
As well as studying, those who can afford it play football and netball, swim and fish in the nearby Nile, attend prayers at local mosques and attend music concerts across the city
displayImages.cleanCaption:
A selfie stick in the Nile
As well as studying, those who can afford it play football and netball, swim and fish in the nearby Nile, attend prayers at local mosques and attend music concerts across the city

displayImages.caption:
Volleyball on the banks of the Nile
Activists have also hosted events and conferences to help bring young people together. In 2011 TEDxYouth@Khartoum assembled local people to ‘share their experiences, exchange ideas and inspire the next generation of leaders’

All images by Mohamed Nureldin Abdallah
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Volleyball on the banks of the Nile
Activists have also hosted events and conferences to help bring young people together. In 2011 TEDxYouth@Khartoum assembled local people to ‘share their experiences, exchange ideas and inspire the next generation of leaders’

All images by Mohamed Nureldin Abdallah

cards.title: Riding high / Vintage photos of Margate's Dreamland in its heyday
cards.rawTitle: Vintage photos of Margate's Dreamland in its heyday

item.title: Riding high: vintage photos of Margate's Dreamland in its heyday
item.trailText: It has been derelict for decades but in the 1950s and 60s the Dreamland amusement park was buzzing with happy holiday makers
item.standFirst:
It has been derelict for decades but in the 1950s and 60s the Dreamland amusement park was buzzing with happy holiday makers, as these vintage snapshots show

  • ‘Pleasure without measure’: Margate’s Dreamland rises from the ashes

cards.title: The Arab Spring failed women – we need a sexual revolution in the Middle East
cards.rawTitle: The Arab Spring failed women – we need a sexual revolution in the Middle East

item.title: We need a sexual revolution in the Middle East
item.trailText: Let's face it, the Arab Spring failed women – they are no closer to liberation than before the uprisings, argues Mona Eltahawy
item.standFirst: 'Let's face it, the Arab Spring failed women. They are no closer to liberation than before the uprisings.' Mona Eltahawy, who was beaten and sexually assaulted by Egyptian riot police in 2011, argues that feminism is a vital movement wherever you are – both 'over here' and 'over there'
item.byline: Mona Eltahawy, Leah Green, Maya Wolfe-Robinson and Caterina Monzani

stillImage.caption: MonaHodingPic Photograph: Mosa'ab Elshamy/Moment Editorial Photograph: Mosa'ab Elshamy/Moment Editorial

cards.title: Elizabeth Hurley at 50 / How she influenced your wardrobe (whether you liked it or not)
cards.rawTitle: How she influenced your wardrobe (whether you liked it or not)

item.title: Elizabeth Hurley at 50: how she has influenced your wardrobe (whether you like it or not)
item.trailText: Britain’s greatest actor turns 50 today – happy birthday Liz! From white jeans to safety pins, here are 10 ways she has changed what you wear
item.standFirst: Britain’s greatest actor turns 50 today – happy birthday Liz! From white jeans to safety pins, here are 10 ways she has changed what you wear

displayImages.caption: This is the Liz creation myth, with Donatella as fairy godmother. Without this dress, there would be no Hurley. One part Botticelli Venus, one part stripper, one part punk. At the premiere of Four Weddings and a Funeral, Hurley managed to turn a night intended to launch one of Britain’s most successful films into the night that launched her Photograph: Dave Benett/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Liz in the safety pin dress
displayImages.cleanCaption: This is the Liz creation myth, with Donatella as fairy godmother. Without this dress, there would be no Hurley. One part Botticelli Venus, one part stripper, one part punk. At the premiere of Four Weddings and a Funeral, Hurley managed to turn a night intended to launch one of Britain’s most successful films into the night that launched her

displayImages.caption: The 53-page album from the Hello special issue on the occasion of Hurley’s marriage to Arun Nayer in 2007 is the stuff of minimalist nightmares. Think Elton John’s White Tie and Tiara Ball with a Bollywood theme and celebrity cricket. Judging by his expression, young Damian was more of a Celine and Scandi chic man, even at age four Photograph: Hello!
displayImages.cleanCaption: The 53-page album from the Hello special issue on the occasion of Hurley’s marriage to Arun Nayer in 2007 is the stuff of minimalist nightmares. Think Elton John’s White Tie and Tiara Ball with a Bollywood theme and celebrity cricket. Judging by his expression, young Damian was more of a Celine and Scandi chic man, even at age four

displayImages.caption: Liz Hurley and white jeans go together like Gordons and tonic. The perfect off-duty wear for a woman who doesn’t really do dressing down, white jeans project money, frivolity and – thanks to that Jilly Cooper-ish jodhpur-tightness – a certain frolickiness. Still the uniform of women who drink white wine on Kings Road, Chelsea Photograph: Erik C Pendzich/Rex Features
displayImages.cleanCaption: Liz Hurley and white jeans go together like Gordons and tonic. The perfect off-duty wear for a woman who doesn’t really do dressing down, white jeans project money, frivolity and – thanks to that Jilly Cooper-ish jodhpur-tightness – a certain frolickiness. Still the uniform of women who drink white wine on Kings Road, Chelsea

displayImages.caption: ‘Does this dress show my knickers? It does? Excellent, I’ll wear my best leopard-print pants.’ And no, it’s not for Studio 54, it’s for a wedding. Wowsers Photograph: Barry Batchelor/PA
displayImages.cleanCaption: ‘Does this dress show my knickers? It does? Excellent, I’ll wear my best leopard-print pants.’ And no, it’s not for Studio 54, it’s for a wedding. Wowsers

displayImages.caption: We’re sure Arun Nayer is a really nice man and all, but the Mrs Nayer years were very, very sparkly and very, very pink. Sort of a Global Sloane Barbie look. Not her finest Photograph: Sipa Press/Rex
displayImages.cleanCaption: We’re sure Arun Nayer is a really nice man and all, but the Mrs Nayer years were very, very sparkly and very, very pink. Sort of a Global Sloane Barbie look. Not her finest

displayImages.caption: ‘Mr Powers, my job is to acclimatise you to the 90s. You know, a lot’s changed since 1967.’ So said Vanessa Kensington, Hurley’s Austin Powers alter-ego, while wearing silver go-go boots and a dress that covered approximately 25% of her bottom Photograph: Allstar/PATHE
displayImages.cleanCaption: ‘Mr Powers, my job is to acclimatise you to the 90s. You know, a lot’s changed since 1967.’ So said Vanessa Kensington, Hurley’s Austin Powers alter-ego, while wearing silver go-go boots and a dress that covered approximately 25% of her bottom

displayImages.caption: The nose ring! The fabulous bleach job! The nipples! Liz’s early punk years suggest that if she hadn’t decided to monetise those assets, she could have been a bona fide style icon. Also, love that she’s got a St Tropez tan even then Photograph: Debra Barker/REX/Shutterstock
displayImages.cleanCaption: The nose ring! The fabulous bleach job! The nipples! Liz’s early punk years suggest that if she hadn’t decided to monetise those assets, she could have been a bona fide style icon. Also, love that she’s got a St Tropez tan even then

displayImages.caption: If anyone was born to wear a crown and furs, it was Hurley. Her role in the Royals is the part she was destined to play. Part Kate Middleton, part Princess Diana, part Dubai. More cleavage that one generally sees on monarchs, but then artistic licence is so important for the acting craft, no? Photograph: E! Entertainment
displayImages.cleanCaption: If anyone was born to wear a crown and furs, it was Hurley. Her role in the Royals is the part she was destined to play. Part Kate Middleton, part Princess Diana, part Dubai. More cleavage that one generally sees on monarchs, but then artistic licence is so important for the acting craft, no?

displayImages.caption: The bandage-style dress, as designed by Herve Leger and copied all over the world, is Hurley’s go-to, wear-anywhere look. What it lacks in subtlety it more than makes up for in impact Photograph: REX/Shutterstock
displayImages.cleanCaption: The bandage-style dress, as designed by Herve Leger and copied all over the world, is Hurley’s go-to, wear-anywhere look. What it lacks in subtlety it more than makes up for in impact

displayImages.caption: Alongside the white jeans, one item has been a constant in Hurley’s off-duty wardrobe since forever: the fur gilet. The fur gilet says ski holidays and school drop-off in the 4x4. It says an old-school taste for glamour and diamonds. It does not say: job, or walking further than is comfortable in Jimmy Choo leather boots with 3in heels. It says Liz Hurley Photograph: Simon James/FilmMagic
displayImages.cleanCaption: Alongside the white jeans, one item has been a constant in Hurley’s off-duty wardrobe since forever: the fur gilet. The fur gilet says ski holidays and school drop-off in the 4x4. It says an old-school taste for glamour and diamonds. It does not say: job, or walking further than is comfortable in Jimmy Choo leather boots with 3in heels. It says Liz Hurley

image.caption: This is the Liz creation myth, with Donatella as fairy godmother. Without this dress, there would be no Hurley. One part Botticelli Venus, one part stripper, one part punk. At the premiere of Four Weddings and a Funeral, Hurley managed to turn a night intended to launch one of Britain’s most successful films into the night that launched her Photograph: Dave Benett/Getty Images

More cleavage that one generally sees on monarchs, but then artistic licence is so important for the acting craft, no?

image.caption: The bandage-style dress, as designed by Herve Leger and copied all over the world, is Hurley’s go-to, wear-anywhere look. What it lacks in subtlety it more than makes up for in impact Photograph: REX/Shutterstock
image.cleanCaption: The bandage-style dress, as designed by Herve Leger and copied all over the world, is Hurley’s go-to, wear-anywhere look. What it lacks in subtlety it more than makes up for in impact

image.caption: Alongside the white jeans, one item has been a constant in Hurley’s off-duty wardrobe since forever: the fur gilet. The fur gilet says ski holidays and school drop-off in the 4x4. It says an old-school taste for glamour and diamonds. It does not say: job, or walking further than is comfortable in Jimmy Choo leather boots with 3in heels. It says Liz Hurley Photograph: Simon James/FilmMagic
image.cleanCaption: Alongside the white jeans, one item has been a constant in Hurley’s off-duty wardrobe since forever: the fur gilet. The fur gilet says ski holidays and school drop-off in the 4x4. It says an old-school taste for glamour and diamonds. It does not say: job, or walking further than is comfortable in Jimmy Choo leather boots with 3in heels. It says Liz Hurley

cards.title: Women's evening tops / Five different looks

item.title: Women's evening tops: five different looks
item.trailText: This season’s luxe T-shirt comes in a lovely easy-to-wear, boxy style
item.standFirst: This season’s luxe T-shirt comes in a lovely easy-to-wear, boxy style. Wear them to dress up simple trousers or to add a modern twist to a classic full skirt. Perfect for a Friday night out, a wedding or a hot date
